chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 47-year-old woman with metastatic colon cancer who developed severe hepatocellular liver injury after increasing self-administered fenbendazole. Laboratory examinations showed peak ALT of 2407 U/L, AST of 2435 U/L, ALP of 215 U/L, total bilirubin of 3.1 mg/dL, direct bilirubin of 1.75 mg/dL, and INR of 1.52. The patient improved after stopping fenbendazole, with normalization of liver function tests and safe reintroduction of immunotherapy, indicating recovery.

lab_results.Bilirubin: Total bilirubin 3.1 mg/dL, Direct bilirubin 1.75 mg/dL
